column2: Katherine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Twenty years ago I used to get "weekend" migraines. I was so stressed during the week that the headaches didn't hit me until I relaxed. I would wake up on Saturday with one and it wouldn't go away until Sunday. The cycle would start all over again. I was first prescribed Esgic+ after the headaches/migraines were daily for about 2 weeks. I was convinced the throbbing would never end and started to have panic attacks. After discussing it with my Dr. we determined my headaches moved in and out of severe tension headaches & migraines. The pain was so bad I remember crying while waiting for the prescription to be filled. Twenty minutes after taking it my 2 week torture went away! I'm not kidding. I call Esgic+ my miracle pill. Although I don't need it as often now, as any headache sufferer can understand, I will always have it available. It works GREAT on tension headaches, good on mild or the onset of migraines, and okay on full blown migraines but it still works. It just takes longer. Over the years I have reduced the number of migraines I get by taking it early when I get a tension headache. I got/get most of my tension headaches while at work. I can take 1 pill and can still function. If it doesn't subside enough where I can still work and I need a 2nd pill I know its time to go home. Two or three times a year I'll wake up with a full blown migraine but I am fine if Esgic+ is in my medicine cabinet. I know I can deal with it.
